CONSTRUCTION PROCEDURE 81

from the crossing for the first five years and for the average of the first
five years are tabulated below. See Table 27.

TABLE 27
Patapsco River
Combined with Susquehanna and Potomac River Crossings and Sandy Point Bay Crossing











GROSS REVENUE BASE TOLL OF
NO. OF VEHICLES 25 CENTS WITH COMMUTATION
RATES

First year 1941.............. ... .cciiiiiiiinin... 1,956,000 $396,000.00
Second year 1942............ ... ... ... ... 2,014,000 408,000.00
Third year 1943.............. ... 2,075,000 421,000.00
Fourthyear 1944..............ccoiiiiiiriiivncnns 2,137,000 433,000.00
Fifth year 1945................. ... ... .o 2,180,000 . 442,000.00
Total five years................................. 10,362,000 2,100,000.00
Average of five years.............................. 2,072,000 420,000.00





The report from which the above tabulation of vehicles and revenue have
been quoted has been reviewed by J. E. Greiner Company and is considered
by them to be a thorough, comprehensive and conservative estimate of the
traffic which it is reasonable to expect will use this crossing.

CONSTRUCTION PROCEDURE

The engineering procedure hereinbefore described has been scheduled with
a view of beginning actual construction on this bridge and its approaches in
time to complete the entire work by June, 1940. The construction is di-
vided into main construction items as follows:
Substructure
a. Pedestals for the approach in Fairfield.
b. Piers starting with 1 and 14 and proceeding with 2 and 13,
3 and 12,4 and 11, 5 and 10, 6 and 9, 7 and 8, and including
abutments A, B, C and D and the Canton pedestals and
plers in order that simultaneous operations on two piers
and on the groups of abutments and pedestals may be in
progress on each side of the river with a minimum number
of equipment units.
Superstructure
a. Erection and riveting of the various steel spans.
b. Construction of roadway slab.
c. Painting.
